result.execSummary:
The defendant Katrina M Gruber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge. *Restitution is Joint & Several with co-defendants, Nicholis Frost (15CF98) and Alexander Stanelle (15CF100).

timeConds.notes: *Report clean & sober. *May be served in Waushara or Outagamie County. *May be served on Electronic Monitor.

records.addlTxt: Extending Probation
to Extend Probation
Probation extended-Agent required to file new order on extension

01:28 PM Defendant Katrina M Gruber appeared by phone means. 
Defendant states her agent is Shannon Hein who doesn't appear here today.
Court questions Ms. Gruber as to why her fees should be converted to a civil judgment.  Ms. Gruber states she cannot afford it.  Had been employed.  Court questions defendant further as to why she has not been able to pay fees back in the last 5 years.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds defendant has not made a good faith effort and will extend probation for a period of 1 year.  If there has not been a good faith effort at that time, Court may consider jail time.

**Agent to prepare the order
to Court from DOC agent
for Civil Judgment

Probation review hearing on July 13, 2021 at 01:15 pm.
(emailed DOC)

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission
Supplement to Disposition (Restitution)
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Katrina M Gruber in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  
BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in.
  State has complied with victim notification requirements.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*45 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on August 18, 2016 by 4:30pm, clean & sober.
*May serve in Waushara County or Outagamie County
*Electronic Monitoring will be allowed
*Court Costs = $268.00
*DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
*Restitution = $2,094.06 + $209.40 surcharge = $2,303.46 as per supplement; Joint & Several with Nicholis N Frost 15CF98 & Alexander M Stanelle 15CF100
 
 **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in
Return date on August 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Katrina M Gruber in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the matter is not resolved.  Atty Gumz states that there is co-defendant's in the matter and asks for a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.

Atty Hendee states that in part of the resolution from Waushara County, she will be in jail at the time of the hearing.
Atty Hendee will do a writ if needed.
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts that.  Return date scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Return date on July 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Katrina M Gruber in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant has another case in Waushara County and asks that this be set after June 22nd.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
